intro: Epilobium warakense, commonly known as the Warakense willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Epilobium warakense is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
